options.option: A version control system
An integrated development environment
A programming language
A web development framework

question.text: Question 2: What is the purpose of Git?

options.option: To track changes in files and collaborate with others
To compile and execute code
To design user interfaces
To manage databases

question.answer: To track changes in files and collaborate with others

question.text: Question 3: What is a repository in Git?

options.option: A storage location for Git configuration files
A remote server where Git projects are hosted
A directory that contains a Git project
A file that stores Git commit history

question.answer: A directory that contains a Git project

question.text: Question 4: What is the command used to create a new Git repository?

options.option: git create
git init
git new
git start

question.text: Question 5: What is a commit in Git?

options.option: A saved snapshot of changes in a Git repository
A branch in a Git repository
A file that contains Git configuration settings
A command to merge branches in Git

question.answer: A saved snapshot of changes in a Git repository

question.text: Question 6: What is the purpose of branching in Git?

options.option: To work on new features or experiment without affecting the main codebase
To optimize code execution in Git projects
To generate code documentation from Git comments
To handle user authentication and authorization in Git projects

question.answer: To work on new features or experiment without affecting the main codebase

question.text: Question 7: What is a remote in Git?

options.option: A Git command for renaming files
A version of a Git repository hosted on a different server
A file that stores Git commit history
A command to revert changes in a Git repository

question.answer: A version of a Git repository hosted on a different server

question.text: Question 8: What is the command used to clone an existing Git repository?

options.option: git clone
git copy
git pull
git fetch

question.text: Question 9: What is the purpose of a merge in Git?

options.option: To combine changes from different branches into one
To compress Git commit history for better performance
To validate Git commit messages
To handle user authentication and authorization in Git projects

question.answer: To combine changes from different branches into one

question.text: Question 10: What is the command used to push local changes to a remote Git repository?

options.option: git commit
git add
git push
git merge
